item.title: Smear Campaigns Against Gaza’s Doctors
item.content:encoded: Al Jazeera’s Yasmeen Aboujabal looks at how smear campaigns are being used to discredit Palestinian health workers.

item.title: 100,000 pray at Al-Aqsa amid Israeli restrictions on 2nd Friday of Ramadan
item.content:encoded: Thousands of worshippers attend prayers at Al-Aqsa Mosque, with others turned away despite carrying required permits.

item.title: Israeli settlers violently attack foreign ‘solidarity activists’
item.content:encoded: Israeli settlers attacked a 71-year-old foreign woman and 51-year-old foreign man in the occupied West Bank.

item.title: Second US drone laser incident this month prompts Texas airspace closure
item.content:encoded: Lawmakers criticise mismanagement after El Paso airspace closure following military's anti-drone laser deployment.

item.title: Azov’s hiring spree: Controversial Ukrainian brigade competes for recruits
item.content:encoded: As the Ukrainian army's conscription crisis grows, individual military units are targeting potential fighters.

item.title: ‘Index of Repression:’ documents 964 anti-Palestinian cases in the UK
item.content:encoded: The European Legal Support Center says it’s verified nearly a thousand cases of “anti-Palestinian repression” in the UK.

item.title: What we know about clashes between Pakistan and Afghanistan
item.content:encoded: Clashes along the Pakistan-Afghanistan border have escalated to strikes on Kabul and other cities.

item.title: Has India’s influence in Afghanistan grown under the Taliban?
item.content:encoded: Pakistan has accused Afghanistan of becoming 'a colony of India' but India's relations with Kabul predate the Taliban.

item.title: Air attacks on Kabul push Pakistan-Taliban crisis into uncharted territory
item.content:encoded: Analysts warn escalation may embolden armed groups and destabilise both Afghanistan and Pakistan. What happens next?

item.title: Deadly journeys: Refugees, migrants risk everything to reach Europe
item.content:encoded: Crossing to Europe offers hope but exposes refugees to peril, as militia abuse persists in unsafe Libya.

item.title: Man City play Real Madrid, PSG face Chelsea in Champions League last 16
item.content:encoded: Elsewhere, Barcelona will face Newcastle, Tottenham will play Atletico Madrid and Arsenal will take on Bayer Leverkusen.

item.title: US citizens’ support for Israel at historic low over Gaza genocide: Poll
item.content:encoded: Backing for Israel hits historic nadir, with 41% now sympathizing more with Palestinians, Gallup poll reveals.

item.title: Behind the myths of the British Empire: Nigel Biggar and Mehdi Hasan
item.content:encoded: Mehdi Hasan goes head-to-head with Nigel Biggar on the brutal legacy of Britain’s colonial past.

item.title: F1 driver Doohan says armed men confronted him in Miami after death threats
item.content:encoded: Australia's Jack Doohan says received death threats before being dropped by F1 team Alpine, six races into last season.

item.title: Did Epstein help Israel push for a security deal with Ivory Coast?
item.content:encoded: Latest Epstein files released in January reveal the extent of his relations with some prominent African leaders.

item.title: South Sudan at risk of ‘return to full-scale war’, UN warns
item.content:encoded: UN report warns of 'escalating atrocity risks' amid renewed fighting and widespread impunity over abuses.

item.title: Barcelona vs Villarreal: La Liga – preview, team news, start, lineups
item.content:encoded: Win would provisionally take Barcelona four points ahead of Real Madrid who host Getafe on Monday night.

item.title: Hillary Clinton comments after Epstein hearing
item.content:encoded: Former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton spoke to reporters after finishing her testimony on Epstein.

item.title: Green Party wins UK by-election in blow to Labour, PM Starmer
item.content:encoded: Progressive Greens win closely-watched election in one-time Labour stronghold, while right-wing Reform comes second.

item.title: Pakistan bombs Kabul: Why are Afghanistan and Pakistan fighting?
item.content:encoded: Pakistani defence minister says Pakistan and Afghanistan are now at 'open war'.

item.title: ‘I was so isolated’: Pro-Palestine activist attempted suicide in UK prison
item.content:encoded: Recently bailed Palestine Action-linked activist Charlotte Head, 29, spent 18 months in pre-trial detention.

item.title: Mass graves with 171 bodies found in eastern DR Congo: Report
item.content:encoded: A local governor says authorities found two mass graves in the outskirts of the eastern city of Uvira.

item.title: ‘A dangerous thing’: S Africa’s gang-ridden townships fear army deployment
item.content:encoded: Critics wary of President Cyril Ramaphosa's move to send military to tackle crime, drugs and gangs in three provinces.

item.title: UK investigating whether Epstein used air force bases for sex trafficking
item.content:encoded: Probe of Royal Air Force bases comes amid concerns trafficked women were brought to UK on board Epstein's private jets.

item.title: Inside Israel’s airport interrogations
item.content:encoded: At Ben Gurion airport, invasive security checks are routine for many Palestinians, journalists and other travellers.
